intro: Lannea minimifolia, commonly known as the dwarf lannea, is a small shrub native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants like mango and cashew. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers. Its fruits are small, round, and resemble drupes, containing a single seed. Lannea minimifolia is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in harsh conditions.
